definition: to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: A footnote is made at the bottom of the page.
The Italian proverb is a sadly apt footnote to the latest round of European shenanigans.
sentences.chinese: 对于最新这轮欧洲闹剧来说，这是个极为恰当的注脚。

sentences.english: But this is just going to be an interesting footnote.
sentences.chinese: 但是这只会是一个有趣的注脚。

sentences.english: As Alfred North Whitehead said, philosophy is a series of footnotes to Plato.
sentences.chinese: 正如怀特海说，哲学是柏拉图的一系列注脚。

sentences.english: Thee numbers in my article refer to the footnotes.
sentences.chinese: 我文章中的数目字指的是注脚。

sentences.english: Be sure to footnote both argument and evidentiary citations.
sentences.chinese: 务必要记得，在引用不同论点和证据时，要加上注脚。

sentences.english: References may be either footnoted or endnoted.
sentences.chinese: 参考资料可以在注脚或文章末端标明。

sentences.english: Failure to use appropriate footnote formatting will lower your grade .
sentences.chinese: 没有用合适的注脚格式会降低你的绩分。

sentences.english: D. Check for proper form on footnotes, quotes, and punctuation.
sentences.chinese: 检查注脚，引言和发音是否用了正确形式。

sentences.english: The numbers in my article refer to the footnotes.
sentences.chinese: 我文章中的数目字指的是注脚。

definition: thick and heavy in colors/to describe sth in colorful language with attention to detail (idiom)
to interpret/to comment and explain/to annotate/to perform (i.e. interpret a theatrical role)/to decode/interpretation/annotation
miniature version of sth/microcosm/epitome/(Tw) to microfilm
don't pass judgment on a person's life until the lid is on the coffin (idiom)
